skill.name: scientific-slides
skill.description: Build slide decks and presentations for research talks. Use this for making PowerPoint slides, conference presentations, seminar talks, research presentations, thesis defense slides, or any scientific talk. Provides slide structure, design templates, timing guidance, and visual validation. Works with PowerPoint and LaTeX Beamer.

skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill contains presentation tools with standard capabilities. Network access is limited to OpenRouter API for image generation. Subprocess calls are scoped to LaTeX compilation with timeout. No suspicious patterns or credential exfiltration. User must provide own API key.

content.value_statement: Build professional scientific presentations with templates, design guides, and AI-powered slide generation. Generate conference talks, seminar presentations, and thesis defense slides using PowerPoint or LaTeX Beamer formats.
actual_capabilities: Generate slide images using AI (Nano Banana Pro via OpenRouter)
Create LaTeX Beamer templates for conferences, seminars, and defenses
Combine slide images into PDF presentations
Validate slide count, timing, and formatting
Convert PDF presentations to images for visual review
Access comprehensive design guides and timing guidelines
limitations: Requires OpenRouter API key for AI image generation features
Does not include actual figure creation or data visualization tools
No voiceover or animation capabilities beyond basic slide transitions
LaTeX compiler must be installed locally for Beamer compilation

use_cases.title: Conference presentations
use_cases.description: Create 15-minute conference talks with proper structure, visuals, and timing guidance

use_cases.title: Thesis defense slides
use_cases.description: Build comprehensive defense presentations with LaTeX Beamer templates and validation tools

use_cases.title: Seminar talks
use_cases.description: Design 45-60 minute academic seminars with professional design principles

prompt_templates.title: Generate title slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a presentation title slide with title: '[Your Title]', subtitle: '[Conference or Subtitle]', and author: '[Your Name]'. Use a professional color scheme matching scientific presentations.

prompt_templates.title: Generate content slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a presentation slide titled '[Slide Title]' with key points: 1) [Point 1], 2) [Point 2], 3) [Point 3]. Include a figure placeholder for data visualization. Professional academic style.

prompt_templates.title: Generate diagram slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a methodology or process diagram slide showing: [Step 1] â†’ [Step 2] â†’ [Step 3]. Clean technical style with clear labels. For use in scientific presentations.

prompt_templates.title: Convert slides to PDF
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the slides_to_pdf.py script to combine slide images from the slides/ directory into a single presentation.pdf file

output_examples.input: Generate a title slide for my machine learning research presentation
output: Slide 1: Title - 'Machine Learning Advances in Healthcare' / 'AI Research Conference 2025' / 'Dr. Jane Smith, University of Research' / Professional navy blue and white color scheme / Bold sans-serif typography / Clean, minimal design

best_practices: Plan your narrative arc: hook, context, problem, approach, results, implications, closure
Spend 40-50% of presentation time on results and key findings
Include citations from research literature to establish credibility
anti_patterns: Avoid text-heavy slides with more than 6 bullet points
Do not use default PowerPoint themes without customization
Avoid tiny fonts below 18pt that are unreadable from the back of the room

faq.question: What tools do I need installed?
faq.answer: Python 3, Pillow for PDF creation, and optionally LaTeX for Beamer templates. AI features require OpenRouter API key.

faq.question: How many slides for a 15-minute talk?
faq.answer: Plan for approximately 15-18 slides, or 1 slide per minute with adjustments for complex figures.

faq.question: Can I use this with PowerPoint?
faq.answer: Yes, use the PDF workflow: generate slides as images, then embed in PowerPoint or combine to PDF first.

faq.question: Is my data safe with AI generation?
faq.answer: AI generation sends prompts to OpenRouter API. No confidential data should be included in prompts.

faq.question: Why is my presentation failing validation?
faq.answer: Check slide count matches duration guidelines, ensure fonts are readable, and verify file sizes are reasonable.

faq.question: What is the difference between PDF and PPTX workflows?
faq.answer: PDF workflow generates complete slides as images then combines to PDF. PPTX workflow generates visual elements for embedding in editable PowerPoint slides.
